meanings.sent1: She felt gypped when the salesman sold her a broken watch.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was gypped when he saw the fake designer bag he bought.
meanings.sent3: The magician gypped the audience by making the coin disappear.
meanings.sent4: The con artist gypped the old man out of his life savings.
meanings.sent5: Being gypped out of his hard-earned money left him feeling angry and betrayed.

meanings.sent1: The scammer gypped many people with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent2: She didn't realize she was being gypped until it was too late.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox gypped the other animals out of their food.
meanings.sent4: The tricky salesman gypped customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: His smooth talk gypped unsuspecting customers into buying overpriced items.

meanings.definition: To unfairly deprive someone of something
meanings.sent1: The unfair ruling gypped him of his rightful inheritance.
meanings.sent2: She felt gypped when her prize was given to someone else by mistake.
meanings.sent3: The rain gypped us of our chance to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected cancellation gypped them of the opportunity to see their favorite band.
meanings.sent5: Being gypped of the recognition she deserved made her work harder to prove herself.
